title: The Game Loop
overview: Master the heart of every game: Input -> Update -> Render -> Repeat.
objectives: Implement a basic game loop using requestAnimationFrame
Differentiate between Fixed and Variable timesteps

sections.title: The Loop Structure
sections.content:
A typical loop involves:
1. **Input**: capturing controls
2. **Update**: moving physics/logic
3. **Render**: drawing to the screen

On the web, we use `requestAnimationFrame()` to sync with the display (usually 60Hz).

sections.title: Practice: Basic Loop
sections.content: Create a `loop` function that calculates `delta` (time passed) and calls `update(delta)` and `render()`.

questions.question: What is `delta` time?
options: The time elapsed since the last frame
questions.correctAnswer: The time elapsed since the last frame
questions.explanation: Delta time allows movement to be smooth regardless of frame rate (frame independence).

questions.question: Why refrain from a simplified variable timestep for complex physics?
options: It can lead to unstable physics behaviors
questions.correctAnswer: It can lead to unstable physics behaviors
questions.explanation: Variable timesteps can cause physics glitches if the frame rate drops significantly.
